Articles.Content: I like to have 2 campaign saves going. One for 32 bit, and another for 64 bit when I feel adventurous. The problem though is it seems all the buildings on the base are already fully upgraded when I start. I'm worried there may be other things "behind the scenes" not yet implemented in 64 bit.

The issue of the buildings is a known issue, Kasper included it in the release FAQ I'm pretty sure. From what I've seen there is nothing "extra" broken in Win x64, but it wasnt the most stable beast before that either. Sorry thats not much hep really

The issue of the buildings is a known issue, Kasper included it in the release FAQ I'm pretty sure. From what I've seen there is nothing "extra" broken in Win x64, but it wasnt the most stable beast before that either. Sorry thats not much hep really

I know it wasn't very stable, but thanks for the reply, at least now I know it's a known problem ^.^
is there any fix for it, I can't run 32bit due to mods violating my memories. if you know what I mean.

is there any fix for it

No. Use Active Texture Management or force OpenGL to reduce memory usage on x86.

force OpenGL to reduce memory usage on x86.

from what i've been reading on the support forums the openGL seems to be broken? due to unity mostly
I can confirm there's no fix for the building situation in win x64 Career. I'm sure its on the list for the future, but I have no idea how far off that is

from what i've been reading on the support forums the openGL seems to be broken? due to unity mostly

Really? It's working fine for me. Windows 8.1 x64, KSP x86.
OpenGL isn't broken, it's just malfunctioning in true fullscreen. You need to combine the -force-opengl flag with the -popupwindow flag if you want to use OpenGL.
